description: Architect/owner designed zinc clad modern extension to Victorian home. Cantilevered glass corners and large rooflights create a light-filled space with views to a contemporary garden. The garden connects the house to the Summer House, a contemporary black larch clad timber framed/ SIPS panels pavilion with views across the adjacent nature reserve.

events.name: Drop in: Open Day
events.notes: Please let us know if you plan to visit. Doing so allows the venue to plan ahead and you will be notified by email about any changes to the programme that might affect your visit.

factsheet.heading: Garden subsidence meant a large engineered solution
paragraphs: The garden is adjacent to a nature reserve (formally a Victorian gravel pit) which is 5m lower than the garden. This resulted in severe subsidence of the land and the old summer house becoming unstable and dangerous. A retaining wall was built along the whole length of the garden (30m) and formed in an 'L' shape, 1.5m wide and 1.5m tall. The new summer house had to be built on 10m piles to rest on rock for stability and built off a concrete deck.

images.title: Zinc clad contemporary extension with cantilevered roof.
Black clad Siberian larch Summer House

name: Private house and Summer House
